page.title: 13KINGSFORD PARK,WOLVERLEY
page.content: Kingsford Country Park lies about one mile to the N.W.of Wolverley. It was opened in 1971 and comprises 200 acres of mixed woodland and heath with numerous sandstone outcrops forming caves and cliffs. There is a variety of recreational facilities including car parks,toilets and picnic sites. Waymarked walks are signposted and there is a trail for disabled people. Horse riding on marked trails is also popular in the park. The park is owned and maintained by the Hereford and Worcester local authority who employ rangers to supervise the site.
